channel.title: Comments on: Back in the blogsphere last

item.title: By: stevelee
item.dc:creator: stevelee
item.description: Thanks Sal. As you say, many thinks going on; exciting times.
item.content:encoded: Thanks Sal. As you say, many thinks going on; exciting times.

item.title: By: Sal Cooke
item.dc:creator: Sal Cooke
item.description:
Just good to have you back in the Sphere (as you say) We have missed you
Great to see you so active with so many things going on .....
item.content:encoded:
Just good to have you back in the Sphere (as you say)
We have missed you

Great to see you so active with so many things going on …..

item.title: By: stevelee
item.dc:creator: stevelee
item.description: Thanks Karen. I don't think size matters so much (ehm), but a blog post does feel somehow more permanent than a tweet. Tweets seem very much of the moment. Being constrained to 140 leads to one kind of creativeness, where-as a blog post feels like a nice wide open space.
item.content:encoded: Thanks Karen. I don’t think size matters so much (ehm), but a blog post does feel somehow more permanent than a tweet. Tweets seem very much of the moment. Being constrained to 140 leads to one kind of creativeness, where-as a blog post feels like a nice wide open space.

item.title: By: Karen Mardahl
item.dc:creator: Karen Mardahl
item.description: Welcome! I sympathize with the 140 problem. I still haven't pushed myself to throw those slightly bigger thoughts onto my blog. I keep thinking a blog post has to have a certain size. Maybe knowing that you are giving this a try will be a push for me, too? I hope so! Cheers!
item.content:encoded: Welcome! I sympathize with the 140 problem. I still haven’t pushed myself to throw those slightly bigger thoughts onto my blog. I keep thinking a blog post has to have a certain size. Maybe knowing that you are giving this a try will be a push for me, too? I hope so! Cheers!
